---
title: "Prime subfield"
description: "Every field contains a smallest subfield isomorphic to Q or to F_p."
---

**Prime subfield**: Let $K$ be a field. The subfield of $K$ generated by $1$ is isomorphic to $\mathbb Q$ if $\operatorname{char}(K)=0$, and is isomorphic to $\mathbb F_p$ if $\operatorname{char}(K)=p>0$.

Apply {{</* knowl id="characteristic-zero-or-prime" text="the characteristic dichotomy for domains" */>}} to the {{</* knowl id="integral-domain" text="integral domain" */>}} underlying a {{</* knowl id="field" text="field" */>}} to see that $\operatorname{char}(K)$ is $0$ or a prime $p$. The {{</* knowl id="characteristic" text="characteristic" */>}} then controls the image of $\mathbb Z\to K$; in characteristic $0$ one takes the induced {{</* knowl id="fraction-field" text="fraction field" */>}} to obtain a copy of $\mathbb Q$, while in characteristic $p$ the image is $\mathbb F_p$.
